titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Borough of Brooklyn Commissioner of Public Works report 1980.004
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2012-01-17T15:11-0500

did.unittitle: Borough of Brooklyn Commissioner of Public Works report
did.abstract: The 1903 annual report of the Commissioner of Public Works for the borough of Brooklyn, William C. Redfield. The report includes reports from the Assistant Commissioner, Bureau of HIghways, Bureau of Sewers, Bureau of Public Buildings and Offices, Bureau of Encumberances and Permits, and the General Bookkeeper. The report is enclosed in a single hardbound volume, is typewritten, and includes some photographs.

origination.label: creator
